구어체 (Colloquial).english: Expression of shock or disbelief, like 'whoa' or 'oh my god.' Used when something unexpected or absurd happens.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 헐, 걔가 회사 그만뒀다고? 입사한 지 일주일밖에 안 됐잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Whoa, he quit the company? It's only been a week since he started.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Shock/disbelief exclamation. Younger generation, casual. Related: 정말?, 진짜?.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Versatile exclamation expressing frustration, exhaustion, sympathy, or mild pain. Used across all ages and situations.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아이고, 허리야. 하루 종일 앉아 있었더니 온몸이 쑤셔.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Oh my, my back. I've been sitting all day and my whole body aches.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Versatile exclamation for frustration/pain/sympathy. Cross-generational. Related: 아이고머니, 아유.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Exclamation of surprise (slightly feminine). Used for unexpected discoveries or mild shock.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어머, 이게 누구야! 여기서 만날 줄이야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Oh my, who is this! I never expected to run into you here.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Surprise (slightly feminine). Related: 어머나, 오마이갓.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Good heavens' or 'oh my goodness.' Expresses strong surprise or disbelief at something remarkable.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 세상에, 십 년 만에 연락이 오다니. 너무 반갑다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Good heavens, getting a call after ten years. I'm so glad to hear from you.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Strong surprise. Related: 세상에 다신, 천만의 말씀.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's absurd' or 'no way.' Used when something seems impossible or unbelievable.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 식당 웨이팅이 세 시간이래. 말도 안 돼, 그냥 다른 데 가자.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: They say the wait at that restaurant is three hours. That's absurd, let's just go somewhere else.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Expressing absurdity. Related: 그럴 리가, 웬일이야.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'What brings you here?' or 'what a rare occasion.' Used when someone does something unexpected or out of character.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 네가 아침에 일찍 일어나다니, 웬일이야? 무슨 일 있어?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You're up early in the morning — what's the occasion? Is something going on?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Asking what's the occasion. Related: 뭐 하는 거야?, 왜 그래?

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That can't be' or 'no way.' Expresses disbelief or denial that something is true.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 시험에 떨어졌다고? 그럴 리가. 네가 얼마나 열심히 했는데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You failed the exam? That can't be. You worked so hard for it.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Disbelief. Related: 말도 안 돼, 있을 수 없지.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'How can it be like this?' Expresses admiration, surprise, or sometimes frustration at an extreme quality.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어쩜 이렇게 맛있지? 이 집 비빔밥은 진짜 예술이다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: How can it be this good? The bibimbap here is truly a work of art.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Expressing amazement. Related: 어떻게 이럴 수 있어, 정말 대단해.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'What is this?' Reaction of confusion, disgust, or disbelief at something right in front of you.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 뭐야 이게, 택배가 완전히 찌그러져서 왔네. 항의해야겠다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: What is this — the package arrived completely crushed. I need to file a complaint.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Confusion/disgust. Related: 이게 뭐 하는 거야?, 이건 너무해.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm dumbfounded' or 'I can't believe this.' Stronger than simple surprise; implies the situation is absurd or outrageous.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 줄 서 있었는데 새치기를 하더라. 진짜 어이가 없어서 말이 안 나왔어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I was standing in line and someone cut in front of me. I was so dumbfounded I couldn't even speak.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Dumbfounded. Related: 황당하다, 코웃음이 나오다.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Euphemistic way to say something is uncomfortable, awkward, or not great. Used to soften refusals or negative opinions.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 날 약속은 좀 그런데, 다른 날은 안 될까?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That day is a bit difficult for me — would another day work?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Hmm, well...' or 'I'm not so sure.' Non-committal response when you don't want to give a definite answer.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이번 프로젝트 성공할 수 있을까요?" "글쎄요, 아직 변수가 많아서 뭐라 말하기 어렵네요."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Do you think this project can succeed?" "Well... there are still a lot of variables, so it's hard to say."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's true, but...' Acknowledges someone's point while signaling disagreement or a reservation is coming.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그렇긴 한데, 현실적으로 그게 가능할까? 예산도 부족하잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That's true, but is it realistically possible? We don't even have the budget.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'This might sound weird/rude, but...' Preface before saying something potentially awkward or blunt.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 말이 좀 그런데, 그 사람이랑 같이 일하기 좀 힘들지 않아?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: This might sound a bit off, but isn't it kind of hard working with that person?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Depending on how you look at it' or 'in a way.' Used to offer an alternative perspective or soften a statement.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어떻게 보면 오히려 잘된 거야. 그 회사 얼마 후에 망했잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: In a way, it actually worked out for the better. That company went under not long after.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Well, I suppose that's possible' or 'that can happen.' Casual acceptance or concession, sometimes reluctant.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 실수한 거에 대해 사과했대. 뭐 그럴 수도 있지, 누구나 실수하니까.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: He said he apologized for the mistake. Well, that can happen — everyone makes mistakes.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'To be honest' or 'frankly speaking.' Used before delivering a candid opinion, often one the listener might not want to hear.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 솔직히 말하면 나도 별로 기대 안 했는데, 의외로 재밌더라.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: To be honest, I wasn't expecting much either, but it was surprisingly fun.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'The way I see it' or 'in my opinion.' Introduces a personal assessment, slightly hedged to avoid sounding too assertive.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 보기엔 아직 준비가 덜 된 것 같아. 조금 더 다듬는 게 어때?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The way I see it, it doesn't seem quite ready yet. How about polishing it a bit more?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'For no good reason' or 'unnecessarily.' Expresses regret about a pointless action or an inexplicable feeling.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 괜히 말했나 봐. 분위기가 갑자기 어색해졌어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I guess I shouldn't have said anything. The mood suddenly got awkward.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's a bit awkward to say this, but...' Polite preface before saying something delicate or potentially unwelcome.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 말하기 좀 뭐하지만, 네 발표 자료에 오타가 좀 많아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It's a bit awkward to say this, but there are quite a few typos in your presentation materials.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm dying (of...).' Hyperbolic suffix expressing an extreme state — hunger, tiredness, boredom, heat, etc.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 배고파 죽겠다. 점심 안 먹었더니 정말 쓰러질 것 같아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I'm starving to death. I skipped lunch and I feel like I'm going to collapse.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's no joke' or 'it's seriously intense.' Emphasizes that something is extreme in degree — positively or negatively.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 오늘 추위 장난 아니다. 나가자마자 후회했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The cold today is no joke. I regretted it the moment I stepped outside.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's driving me crazy.' Expresses overwhelming frustration, stress, or sometimes excitement.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 옆집에서 새벽 두 시까지 노래를 불러. 미치겠다, 진짜.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The neighbors are singing until 2 AM. It's driving me insane, honestly.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's amazing' or 'unbeatable.' Strong compliment meaning something is exceptionally good.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 집 갈비탕 끝내준다. 여기 자주 와야겠다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The galbitang here is incredible. I should come here more often.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's not just once or twice.' Emphasizes that something has happened repeatedly, implying frustration or a pattern.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 사람이 약속을 어긴 게 한두 번이 아니야. 이제 못 믿겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It's not just once or twice that he's broken promises. I can't trust him anymore.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Does that even make sense?' Rhetorical question expressing that something is completely unreasonable.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 월급은 그대로인데 일만 두 배로 늘었어. 이게 말이 되냐?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: My salary is the same but the workload doubled. Does that even make sense?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You have no idea how much...' Emphasizes an extreme degree of something that's hard to convey.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 소식 듣고 얼마나 기뻤는지 몰라. 눈물이 날 뻔했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You have no idea how happy I was to hear that news. I almost cried.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm overwhelmed' or 'I can't think straight.' Describes being so busy or chaotic that you lose track of things.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이사 준비하느라 요즘 정신이 없어. 뭐가 어디 있는지도 모르겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I've been so overwhelmed preparing for the move. I don't even know where anything is.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Why is there so much of this?' Exclamation of exasperation at an excessive quantity of something.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 서류가 뭐가 이렇게 많아, 이걸 언제 다 처리해?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Why is there so much paperwork? When am I supposed to get through all of this?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's not just...' / 'And that's not even the only thing.' Rhetorical expression meaning the problem goes far beyond what was mentioned.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 돈 문제가 어디 그것뿐이겠어. 시간도 없고 사람도 부족해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The money issue is not even the half of it. There's no time and not enough people either.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You know what' or 'so listen.' Conversation opener to get someone's attention before introducing a topic.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 있잖아, 나 요즘 고민이 하나 있는데 얘기 좀 해도 돼?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Hey, so listen — I've been worried about something lately. Can I talk to you about it?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Exactly' or 'that's what I'm saying.' Used to strongly agree with someone, or as a filler meaning 'so' or 'I mean.'
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이번 일은 좀 심하지 않아?" "그러니까, 나도 그 말을 하고 싶었어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Isn't this going a bit too far?" "Exactly — that's what I wanted to say."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Oh right' or 'that reminds me.' Used when you suddenly remember something mid-conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아 맞다, 내일 회의 시간 바뀐 거 알지? 두 시로 옮겨졌어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Oh right, you know the meeting time changed tomorrow, right? It moved to 2 o'clock.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's not what I mean' or 'no, actually.' Used to correct a misunderstanding or redirect the conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그게 아니라, 내 말은 아예 안 된다는 게 아니고 좀 더 생각해 보자는 거야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That's not what I mean — I'm not saying it's impossible, I'm saying let's think about it more.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'How should I put it' or 'what's the word.' Filler used while searching for the right expression.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 영화가, 뭐랄까, 슬프면서도 따뜻한 느낌이었어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That movie was, how should I put it, sad but warm at the same time.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That aside' or 'anyway.' Used to acknowledge a point then shift to a different topic.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그건 그렇고, 주말에 시간 있어? 같이 밥 먹자.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That aside, are you free this weekend? Let's grab a meal.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'By the way' or 'anyway' (topic pivot). Used to change the subject naturally in casual conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그나저나 너 요즘 운동 시작했다며? 몸이 달라진 것 같은데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: By the way, I heard you started working out recently? You look like you've changed.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Come to think of it' or 'well, you have a point.' Concedes that the other person's argument is valid after initial resistance.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 하긴, 네 말도 맞아. 서두르면 오히려 실수할 수 있지.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Come to think of it, you're right. If we rush, we might make mistakes instead.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'And so' or 'and then.' Casual connective used in storytelling to link events. More spoken than written.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 버스를 놓쳤어. 그래 가지고 택시를 탔는데 택시비가 장난 아니더라.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I missed the bus. And so I took a taxi, and the fare was no joke.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'But wait' or 'hold on though.' Used to interject with a new thought, mild objection, or shift in direction.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아니 근데, 그 사람이 왜 거기 있었어? 출장 간다고 하지 않았어?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: But wait, why was he there? Didn't he say he was going on a business trip?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's what I'm saying.' Emphatic agreement, confirming that someone just expressed exactly what you think.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "요즘 물가가 너무 올랐어." "내 말이. 장 보러 갈 때마다 깜짝 놀라."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Prices have gone up so much lately." "That's what I'm saying. I'm shocked every time I go grocery shopping."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Of course' or 'obviously.' Emphatic affirmation that something goes without saying.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이번에 도와줄 수 있어?" "당연하지, 말만 해."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Can you help me with this?" "Of course — just say the word."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Tell me about it' or 'who would disagree.' Strong agreement implying the point is so obvious nobody could argue.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이 날씨에 일하러 가기 싫다." "누가 아니래, 나도 집에서 쉬고 싶어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "I don't want to go to work in this weather." "Tell me about it — I want to stay home and rest too."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Fair point' or 'acknowledged.' Casual one-word concession validating someone's argument. Popular among younger speakers.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이 드라마 연출이 진짜 좋지 않아?" "인정. 특히 마지막 장면은 소름 돋았어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Isn't the directing in this drama really good?" "Fair point. The last scene especially gave me chills."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I totally relate.' Expresses deep agreement or shared feeling about a situation or opinion.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "나이 들수록 시간이 빨리 간다는 말, 진짜 맞는 것 같아." "완전 공감. 올해도 벌써 반이 지났잖아."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "The saying that time flies faster as you age seems really true." "I totally relate. Half of this year is already gone."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Right?' Casual contraction of 그렇지, used to seek or express quick agreement in conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "여기 분위기 진짜 좋다, 그치?" "응, 다음에 또 오자."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "The atmosphere here is really great, right?" "Yeah, let's come again next time."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Surely not' or 'no way.' Expresses disbelief or reluctance to accept that something could possibly be true.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 설마 걔가 진짜로 회사를 옮긴 거야? 농담인 줄 알았는데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You're not telling me he actually switched companies? I thought it was a joke.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Not really' or 'I'm not into it.' Mild, casual way to express that something doesn't appeal to you.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "이 식당 어때?" "음, 별로인데. 지난번에 왔을 때 맛이 좀 그랬어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "How about this restaurant?" "Hmm, not really. The taste was a bit off last time I came."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I don't think that's right' or 'that seems off.' Softened disagreement used to gently push back on an idea.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "그냥 이대로 제출하면 안 될까?" "그건 좀 아닌 것 같은데, 한 번 더 검토하자."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Can't we just submit it as is?" "I don't think that's a good idea — let's review it one more time."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'What are you talking about?' Dismissive response when someone's statement seems nonsensical or off-base.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "네가 잘못한 거 아니야?" "무슨 소리야, 나는 아무 관련 없어."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "Wasn't it your fault?" "What are you talking about? I had nothing to do with it."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm so annoyed' or 'this is irritating.' Direct expression of annoyance at a situation or person.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 인터넷이 또 끊겼어. 진짜 짜증 나, 이번 달에만 벌써 세 번째야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The internet went out again. I'm so annoyed — this is already the third time this month.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Again?' or 'Not this again.' Exasperated reaction when an unwanted situation keeps repeating.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: "내일도 야근이래." "또야? 이번 주만 벌써 네 번째잖아."
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: "They said it's overtime again tomorrow." "Again? That's already the fourth time just this week."
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm going to lose my mind.' Expresses extreme frustration or the feeling of being pushed past one's limit.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 서류를 세 번이나 다시 쓰라고 해. 환장하겠다, 진짜.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: They're making me rewrite the documents for the third time. I'm going to lose my mind, seriously.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I'm completely drained.' Describes being physically or mentally exhausted from a tedious or taxing ordeal.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이사 짐 다 옮기고 나니까 진이 다 빠졌어. 손가락 하나 까딱 못 하겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: After moving all the boxes, I'm completely drained. I can't lift a finger.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Stop it already' or 'cut it out.' Tells someone to stop doing something repetitive or annoying.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 자꾸 같은 얘기 반복하지 마. 그만 좀 해, 나도 알고 있다고.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Stop repeating the same thing. Cut it out already — I know.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'All I can do is sigh.' Resigned frustration when a situation is so bad there is nothing left to say.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 다음 달 카드값 보고 한숨밖에 안 나왔어. 어디서부터 줄여야 할지 모르겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: When I saw next month's credit card bill, all I could do was sigh. I don't know where to start cutting back.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'There's no end in sight.' Expresses frustration with a task or situation that seems to go on forever.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 보고서 작성 끝이 안 보인다. 쓰면 쓸수록 추가 자료가 필요해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: There's no end in sight with this report. The more I write, the more additional materials I need.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's a headache' or 'what a pain.' Describes something troublesome and difficult to resolve.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 윗집 소음 문제 때문에 골치 아파. 말해도 안 듣거든.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The noise from the upstairs neighbor is such a headache. They don't listen even when I talk to them.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Whatever happens, happens.' Resigned expression of giving up trying to control a frustrating situation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 더 이상 손 쓸 게 없어. 될 대로 되라, 나는 최선을 다했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: There's nothing more I can do. Whatever happens, happens — I did my best.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Exasperated sigh expressing weariness, annoyance, or mild disgust. Heavier and more drawn-out than a simple 'ah.'
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어휴, 이 더위에 에어컨도 고장이야? 참 되는 일이 하나도 없다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Ugh, the AC is broken in this heat? Nothing is going right.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'No one else but you could do this.' Strong compliment expressing that someone is uniquely skilled or reliable.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이렇게 빨리 해결해 줄 줄은 몰랐어. 역시 너밖에 없다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I didn't expect you to solve it this fast. No one else could've done it but you.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's insane' or 'that's incredible.' Slang expressing strong admiration for something impressive.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 혼자서 이 프로젝트 다 한 거야? 야, 진짜 쩐다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You did this whole project by yourself? Dude, that's incredible.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'That's so you.' Compliment acknowledging that someone's action perfectly reflects their best qualities.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 바쁜데도 남 도와주는 거 보니까 역시 너답다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Seeing you help others even when you're busy — that's so you.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You've got great sense.' Praises someone's perceptiveness, good taste, or situational awareness.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 선물 고르는 거 진짜 센스 있다. 내가 딱 갖고 싶었던 건데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You've got such great taste in picking gifts. This is exactly what I wanted.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You're good at everything.' Admiring exclamation when someone shows unexpected talent in yet another area.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그림도 이렇게 잘 그려? 별걸 다 잘하네, 진짜.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You draw this well too? You're seriously good at everything.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'I knew you'd pull it off.' Expression of confidence in someone, said after they succeed at something.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 합격한 거 축하해! 네가 해낼 줄 알았어, 한 번도 의심 안 했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Congratulations on passing! I knew you'd pull it off — I never doubted you.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'You're pretty good at this.' Understated, playful compliment implying someone is actually very skilled.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 당구 처음이라며? 좀 치는데? 완전 거짓말이지.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You said this was your first time playing billiards? You're pretty good — you're totally lying.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It's different when you do it.' Compliment that someone brings a special quality or skill that elevates the result.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 같은 레시피인데 니가 하면 다르다. 훨씬 맛있어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It's the same recipe, but it's different when you make it. It's way more delicious.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'It'd be a waste to give up now.' Encouragement urging someone to keep going because they have already invested so much.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 여기서 그만두려고? 이만큼 했는데 포기하기엔 아깝다. 조금만 더 힘내 봐.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You're going to quit here? After coming this far, it'd be a waste to give up. Push through just a bit more.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'How did you even come up with that?' Expresses admiration for someone's unexpected creativity or cleverness.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 아이디어 진짜 기발하다. 어떻게 그런 생각을 했어?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: This idea is really brilliant. How did you even come up with that?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'So, about that...' Transition phrase used to segue from casual talk to the real point or a favor you want to ask.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그래서 말인데, 혹시 이번 주 토요일에 차 좀 빌려줄 수 있어?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: So about that... could you maybe lend me your car this Saturday?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Since we're on the topic' or 'while we're at it.' Brings up something related to the current subject.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 말 나온 김에 하나만 더 얘기할게. 다음 달 회비 인상 건도 논의해야 해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Since we're on the topic, let me bring up one more thing. We need to discuss the fee increase next month.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'But seriously though.' Shifts to a more earnest or important point within a casual conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 근데 진짜, 너 요즘 살 많이 빠진 것 같아. 무슨 비결이야?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: But seriously, you look like you've lost a lot of weight lately. What's your secret?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Setting that aside' or 'that's secondary.' Dismisses one point to redirect attention to something more urgent.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 돈은 그건 둘째 치고, 시간이 부족한 게 더 큰 문제야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Money aside, the bigger problem is that we don't have enough time.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'Anyway' or 'in any case.' Wraps up a tangent or debate and refocuses the conversation on the main point.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이유야 어쨌든, 결과적으로 잘 됐으니 됐지 뭐.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Whatever the reason, it worked out in the end, so it's fine.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'The thing is' or 'what I mean is.' Clarifying preface before explaining a point more precisely.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 하고 싶은 말이 뭐냐면, 이번 기회를 놓치면 안 된다는 거야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: What I'm trying to say is that we can't afford to miss this opportunity.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'At any rate' or 'anyway.' Quick conversational wrap-up or pivot, slightly more casual than 어쨌든.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아무튼 결론은 내일까지 끝내야 한다는 거지? 알겠어, 해 볼게.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: At any rate, the bottom line is it needs to be done by tomorrow, right? Got it, I'll try.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'The reason I'm bringing this up is...' Polite preface before stating the real purpose of a conversation or call.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 전화한 건 다름이 아니라, 주말에 도움이 좀 필요해서.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The reason I'm calling is that I need some help this weekend.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'This is off-topic, but...' Signals a pivot to a completely unrelated subject mid-conversation.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 딴 얘기지만, 너 아까 말한 그 책 제목이 뭐였어? 갑자기 생각났어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: This is off-topic, but what was the title of that book you mentioned earlier? It just popped into my head.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: 'So here's the thing.' Introduces a point you have been building up to or hesitating to say.
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그게 말이야, 사실 나 다음 달에 이직하려고.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: So here's the thing — actually, I'm planning to change jobs next month.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: How impressive (sarcastic — meaning the opposite)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 약속을 또 어겼네? 참 대단하시다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You broke your promise again? How impressive.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Sure, you did everything right (dismissive sarcasm)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 남 탓만 하더니, 그래, 네가 다 잘했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You kept blaming others — sure, you did everything right.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Oh, you must be suffering so much (ironic sympathy)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 하루 종일 폰만 봤으면서, 아이고 고생이 많으시다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You were on your phone all day, yet oh, you must be suffering so much.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: You have zero social awareness (pointed observation)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 분위기가 이런데 혼자 웃고 있어? 눈치도 없다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The mood is like this and you're laughing alone? Zero social awareness.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: All talk, no action
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 매번 하겠다고만 하지, 입만 살았어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You always say you'll do it — you're all talk.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Is that even something you should say?
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 사과한다면서 그게 말이라고 해?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You call that an apology? Is that even something to say?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: What a show-off (dismissive)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 한 번 맞았다고 잘난 척은.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You got one right and now you're showing off.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Where did you pick up that bad habit? (rhetorical, mocking)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어른 앞에서 그렇게 말하면, 어디서 배운 거야 그 버릇?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Talking like that in front of elders — where did you pick up that habit?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Oh, really? (can be sarcastic or genuinely surprised depending on tone)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 자기가 직접 요리했다고? 오, 진짜?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You cooked it yourself? Oh, really?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: You sure have a way with words (sarcastically implying they only talk)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 변명할 때 보면 하여튼 말은 참 잘해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: When it comes to making excuses, you sure have a way with words.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Whoa, what is this?! (shock/disbelief)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 헉, 이게 뭐야! 갑자기 사장이 전체 메일을 보냈어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Whoa, what is this?! The boss suddenly sent a company-wide email.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: That gives me chills (shock/awe/creepiness)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 우연의 일치라기엔 소름 끼친다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It gives me chills to call it just a coincidence.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: To be so stunned/appalled one is speechless
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 정도면 기가 차서 말이 안 나온다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: At this point, I'm so stunned I can't even speak.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Why out of the blue?
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 뜬금없이 왜 전 여자친구 이야기를 꺼내?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Why are you bringing up your ex-girlfriend out of the blue?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Everything goes dark before one's eyes (overwhelmed/shocked)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 시험 결과를 보는 순간 눈앞이 캄캄했다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The moment I saw the test results, everything went dark.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I thought it wouldn't be the case, but... (surprised it happened)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 설마 했는데, 아닐 줄 알았는데 진짜 합격했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I didn't think it would happen, but I actually passed.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I had no idea in my wildest dreams
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 사람이 범인이었다니 꿈에도 몰랐다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I had no idea in my wildest dreams that person was the culprit.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I thought my heart was going to stop (extreme shock)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 뒤에서 갑자기 소리 질러서 심장이 멎는 줄 알았다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Someone suddenly screamed from behind — I thought my heart was going to stop.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Is this for real? (disbelief at something happening)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 시험 범위가 전부라고? 이게 실화야?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The exam covers everything? Is this for real?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: The sky turned yellow (feeling faint from shock/despair)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 통장 잔고를 확인하고 하늘이 노래졌다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I checked my bank balance and nearly fainted.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Just think about it one more time (gentle persuasion)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 섣불리 결정하지 말고 한번만 더 생각해 봐.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Don't decide hastily — just think about it one more time.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I understand your position, but... (prelude to disagreeing)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 네 입장은 알겠는데, 이건 좀 아닌 것 같아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I understand your position, but I don't think this is right.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Isn't that a different issue? (redirecting an argument)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 비용 문제를 말하는데 왜 감정 이야기를 해? 그건 좀 다른 문제 아니야?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: We're talking about costs, so why bring up feelings? Isn't that a different issue?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: By that logic... (challenging someone's reasoning)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 논리대로라면 아무도 새로운 시도를 못 하겠네.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: By that logic, nobody could ever try anything new.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: If you think about it carefully / when you really look into it
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 따지고 보면 네가 먼저 약속을 어긴 거잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: When you really look into it, you were the one who broke the promise first.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).korean: 안 그래도 그 얘기 하려고 했는데
구어체 (Colloquial).english: I was actually just about to bring that up
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 안 그래도 그 얘기 하려고 했는데, 네가 먼저 꺼내니까 잘됐다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I was just about to bring that up — good thing you mentioned it first.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Don't make excuses
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 바빠서 못 했다니, 핑계 대지 마.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You said you were too busy — don't make excuses.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Are you going to insist until the very end?
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 증거가 이렇게 있는데 끝까지 우길 거야?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: With this much evidence, are you still going to insist?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Even so, is this right? (conceding a point but still disagreeing)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 힘들었던 건 알아. 그렇다고 이게 맞아?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I know it was hard. But even so, is this the right thing to do?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Just you wait / We'll see (mild threat or determination)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 지금은 웃어도 두고 보자, 누가 맞는지.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Laugh now, but just you wait — we'll see who's right.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Hey, did you hear? (starting gossip)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 야, 들었어? 옆 부서 과장이 갑자기 사표 냈대.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Hey, did you hear? The manager in the next department suddenly resigned.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: So what happened? (egging on a story)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 거기까지 알고 끊으면 어떡해, 그래서 어떻게 됐는데?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You can't stop there — so what happened?
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: No but the really funny thing is... (storytelling transition)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아니 근데 진짜 웃긴 게, 다음 날 본인은 아무 일 없다는 듯이 나왔어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: But the really funny thing is, the next day they showed up acting like nothing happened.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: So they say / Allegedly (hearsay marker)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이번 인사이동에서 팀장이 바뀐다 카더라.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: They say the team leader is changing in the next personnel reshuffle.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: According to rumors
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 소문에 의하면 그 두 사람이 사귄대.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: According to rumors, those two are dating.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: That person has always been like that (dismissive characterization)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 놀랄 것도 없어, 그 사람 원래 좀 그래.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Nothing to be surprised about — that person has always been like that.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: From what I've heard (introducing secondhand info)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 듣자 하니 그쪽 회사 분위기가 완전 엉망이래.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: From what I've heard, the atmosphere at that company is a total mess.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: There's a backstory to that
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 걔가 왜 갑자기 그만뒀는지 알아? 그 뒷이야기가 있어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Do you know why they suddenly quit? There's a backstory.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I didn't see it myself, but... (hedging before gossip)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 직접 본 건 아닌데, 그날 사무실에서 큰 소리가 났다고 해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I didn't see it myself, but they say there was a lot of shouting in the office that day.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I probably shouldn't say this, but... (pretending to hold back before sharing)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 함부로 말하면 안 되는데, 그 프로젝트 사실 거의 엎어질 뻔했대.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I probably shouldn't say this, but that project almost fell apart.
구어체 (Colloquial).notes: Related concepts and usage variations in natural Korean.
